intro: Gardenia naumpapata, commonly known as the Naupapa gardenia, is a species native to the Pacific Islands. It is a flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family, characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and fragrant white flowers. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, often reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its flowers are usually borne in clusters and bloom during the summer months. The fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, which are dispersed by wind or water.
